abstract: Anderson Chamapuro Dogirama and Alejandro Palacios Rengifo, two Colombian men involved in the kidnapping of an American citizen in Latin America, are sentenced in Manhattan to at least a decade in prison; two were convicted in June along with a third man, Edilberto Berrio Ortiz, of hostage-taking and conspiracy charges stemming from the 2008 kidnapping in Panama of an American man.
snippet: The two men, who said they had been kidnapped in their youth by a South American terrorist group, received prison terms of at least a decade each.
lead_paragraph: The two men, who said they had been kidnapped in their youth by a South American terrorist group, received prison terms of at least a decade each.

headline.main: Colombian Men Sentenced in Kidnapping of American
headline.print_headline: Colombian Men Sentenced In Kidnapping of American
headline.seo: FARC Members Convicted in American’s Kidnapping
